abstract: Federal jury finds Pacific Gas and Electric Co guilty of five counts of safety violations and one count of obstruction in connection with 2010 gas pipeline explosion that killed eight people and injured 58  in San Bruno, Calif; yet-unexplained decision by federal prosecutors to reduce fine from $562 million to mere $6 million baffles court observers.
lead_paragraph: A jury in San Francisco found that Pacific Gas & Electric violated pipeline safety laws when a blast leveled a neighborhood.
snippet: A jury in San Francisco found that Pacific Gas & Electric violated pipeline safety laws when a blast leveled a neighborhood....

headline.main: California Utility Found Guilty of Violations in 2010 Gas Explosion That Killed 8
headline.print_headline: California Utility Convicted in 2010 Explosion That Killed 8
